intro: Neophloga mananjarensis, commonly known as the Madagascar flame tree, is a strikingly ornamental plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with long, narrow leaflets and produces cylindrical, woody pods that contain seeds. Neophloga mananjarensis is often cultivated for its showy blossoms and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems and is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal.
